trans-unit.source: View and manage StorSimple jobs | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: View and manage StorSimple jobs | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes the StorSimple Manager service Jobs page and how to use it to track recent, current, and scheduled backup jobs.
trans-unit.target: Describes the StorSimple Manager service Jobs page and how to use it to track recent, current, and scheduled backup jobs.

trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service to view and manage StorSimple jobs
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service to view and manage StorSimple jobs

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The Jobs page provides a single central portal for viewing and managing jobs that were started on devices connected to your StorSimple Manager service.
trans-unit.target: The Jobs page provides a single central portal for viewing and managing jobs that were started on devices connected to your StorSimple Manager service.

trans-unit.source: You can view scheduled, running, completed, and failed jobs for multiple devices.
trans-unit.target: You can view scheduled, running, completed, and failed jobs for multiple devices.

trans-unit.source: Results are presented in a tabular format.
trans-unit.target: Results are presented in a tabular format.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Jobs page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Jobs page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can quickly find the jobs you are interested in by filtering on fields such as:
trans-unit.target: You can quickly find the jobs you are interested in by filtering on fields such as:

trans-unit.source: Status – Jobs can be running, scheduled, failed, completed, canceling, or canceled.
trans-unit.target: Status – Jobs can be running, scheduled, failed, completed, canceling, or canceled.

trans-unit.source: Type – Jobs can be created as a result of a scheduled or an on-demand backup (Take Backup), cloning, a device restore, or an update operation.
trans-unit.target: Type – Jobs can be created as a result of a scheduled or an on-demand backup (Take Backup), cloning, a device restore, or an update operation.

trans-unit.source: Devices – Jobs are initiated on a certain device connected to your service.
trans-unit.target: Devices – Jobs are initiated on a certain device connected to your service.

trans-unit.source: From and To – Jobs can be filtered based on the date and time range.
trans-unit.target: From and To – Jobs can be filtered based on the date and time range.

trans-unit.source: The filtered jobs are then tabulated on the basis of the following attributes:
trans-unit.target: The filtered jobs are then tabulated on the basis of the following attributes:

trans-unit.source: Type – Backup, clone, restore, failover, or update.
trans-unit.target: Type – Backup, clone, restore, failover, or update.

trans-unit.source: Status – Running, scheduled, failed, completed, canceling, or canceled.
trans-unit.target: Status – Running, scheduled, failed, completed, canceling, or canceled.

trans-unit.source: Entity – The jobs can be associated with a volume, a backup policy, or a device.
trans-unit.target: Entity – The jobs can be associated with a volume, a backup policy, or a device.

trans-unit.source: A clone job is associated with a volume, whereas a scheduled backup job is associated with a backup policy.
trans-unit.target: A clone job is associated with a volume, whereas a scheduled backup job is associated with a backup policy.

trans-unit.source: A device job is created as a result of a disaster recovery (DR) or a restore operation.
trans-unit.target: A device job is created as a result of a disaster recovery (DR) or a restore operation.

trans-unit.source: Device – The name of the device on which the job was started.
trans-unit.target: Device – The name of the device on which the job was started.

trans-unit.source: Started On – The time when the job was started.
trans-unit.target: Started On – The time when the job was started.

trans-unit.source: Progress – The percentage completion of a running job.
trans-unit.target: Progress – The percentage completion of a running job.

trans-unit.source: For a completed job, this should always be 100%.
trans-unit.target: For a completed job, this should always be 100%.

trans-unit.source: The list of jobs is refreshed every 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The list of jobs is refreshed every 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: You can perform the following job-related actions on this page:
trans-unit.target: You can perform the following job-related actions on this page:

trans-unit.source: View job details
trans-unit.target: View job details

trans-unit.source: Cancel a job
trans-unit.target: Cancel a job

trans-unit.source: View job details
trans-unit.target: View job details

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to view the details of any job.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to view the details of any job.

trans-unit.source: To view job details
trans-unit.target: To view job details

trans-unit.source: On the Jobs page, display the job(s) you are interested in by running a query with appropriate filters.
trans-unit.target: On the Jobs page, display the job(s) you are interested in by running a query with appropriate filters.

trans-unit.source: You can search for completed, running, or canceled jobs.
trans-unit.target: You can search for completed, running, or canceled jobs.

trans-unit.source: Select a job.
trans-unit.target: Select a job.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click Details.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click Details.

trans-unit.source: In the Backup Job Details dialog box, you can view the status, details, time statistics, and data statistics.
trans-unit.target: In the Backup Job Details dialog box, you can view the status, details, time statistics, and data statistics.

trans-unit.source: Cancel a job
trans-unit.target: Cancel a job

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to cancel a running job.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to cancel a running job.

trans-unit.source: To cancel a job
trans-unit.target: To cancel a job

trans-unit.source: On the Jobs page, display the running job(s) that you want to cancel by running a query with appropriate filters.
trans-unit.target: On the Jobs page, display the running job(s) that you want to cancel by running a query with appropriate filters.

trans-unit.source: Select the job.
trans-unit.target: Select the job.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, click Cancel.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, click Cancel.

trans-unit.source: When prompted for confirmation, click Yes.
trans-unit.target: When prompted for confirmation, click Yes.

trans-unit.source: This job is now canceled.
trans-unit.target: This job is now canceled.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Learn how to manage your StorSimple backup policies</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Learn how to manage your StorSimple backup policies</linkText><title></title></link>.
